tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE SecuritySchedule (
  id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  personnel_id INT,
  shift_start TIMESTAMP,
  shift_end TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE security_personnel (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    rank VARCHAR(20),
    badge_number INT UNIQUE
);
CREATE TABLE shift_schedule (
    shift_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    shift_type VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL,
    start_time TIMESTAMP,
    end_time TIMESTAMP,
    personnel_id INT,
    FOREIGN KEY (personnel_id) REFERENCES security_personnel(id)
);

CREATE TABLE security_personnel (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  name VARCHAR(50),
  badge_number INT,
  position VARCHAR(50)
)

CREATE TABLE schedules (
  schedule_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  security_personnel_id INT,
  shift_date DATE,
  shift_start_time TIME,
  shift_end_time TIME
)

CREATE TABLE shift_assignments (
  assignment_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  security_personnel_id INT,
  shift_date DATE,
  shift_confirmation BOOLEAN
)

CREATE TABLE security_personnel ( 
  personnel_id INT PRIMARY KEY, 
  personnel_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL, 
  personnel_role VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL 
)

CREATE TABLE shift_assignments ( 
  assignment_id INT PRIMARY KEY, 
  personnel_id INT, 
  shift_date DATE NOT NULL, 
  shift_time TIME NOT NULL 
)

CREATE TABLE shifts ( 
  shift_id INT PRIMARY KEY, 
  shift_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL, 
  shift_duration INT NOT NULL 
)

CREATE TABLE schedules ( 
  schedule_id INT PRIMARY KEY, 
  assignment_id INT, 
  shift_id INT, 
  deployment_date DATE NOT NULL 
)
